Greek.title: Moussaka
Greek.instructions: Salt eggplant slices and let sit for 30 minutes. Rinse and pat dry. Brown ground lamb with onion and garlic. Add tomatoes, paste, and seasonings. Simmer for 20 minutes. Make béchamel sauce with butter, flour, milk, eggs, cheese, and nutmeg. Layer eggplant, meat sauce, and béchamel in baking dish. Bake at 375°F for 45 minutes until golden.

Greek.title: Greek Baklava
Greek.instructions: Mix nuts with sugar and spices. Layer phyllo sheets with melted butter and nut mixture. Cut into diamonds. Bake at 350°F for 45 minutes. Make syrup with sugar, water, honey, cinnamon, and lemon juice. Pour hot syrup over cooled baklava. Let sit for 4 hours before serving.

Greek.title: Spanakopita
Greek.instructions: Sauté onion and green onions until soft. Add spinach and cook until wilted. Cool and squeeze out excess water. Mix with herbs, feta, eggs, and seasonings. Layer phyllo sheets with olive oil and spinach mixture. Bake at 375°F for 45 minutes until golden.

Greek.title: Pastitsio
Greek.instructions: Cook pasta according to package directions. Brown ground beef with onion and garlic. Add tomatoes, paste, and seasonings. Simmer for 20 minutes. Make béchamel sauce. Layer pasta, meat sauce, and béchamel in baking dish. Bake at 375°F for 45 minutes until golden.

Greek.title: Greek Salad
Greek.instructions: Combine all vegetables in a large bowl. Add olives and feta cheese. Whisk together olive oil, vinegar, oregano, salt, and pepper. Pour dressing over salad and toss gently. Serve immediately.

Italian.title: Osso Buco alla Milanese
Italian.instructions: Season veal shanks with salt and pepper. Brown in oil and butter. Add vegetables and cook until soft. Add wine, stock, tomatoes, and seasonings. Simmer for 2 hours until tender. Serve with risotto and gremolata.

Italian.title: Risotto ai Porcini
Italian.instructions: Soak mushrooms in hot water. Sauté onion and garlic in oil. Add rice and cook for 2 minutes. Add wine and cook until absorbed. Add stock gradually, stirring constantly. Add mushrooms and cook until rice is creamy. Stir in cheese and butter. Garnish with parsley.

Italian.title: Saltimbocca alla Romana
Italian.instructions: Pound veal cutlets thin. Top each with prosciutto and sage leaf. Secure with toothpicks. Dredge in flour. Cook in oil for 2 minutes per side. Add wine and stock. Simmer for 5 minutes. Remove toothpicks and serve hot.

Italian.title: Penne all'Arrabbiata
Italian.instructions: Cook pasta according to package directions. Heat oil and cook garlic and chilies. Add wine and cook until reduced. Add tomatoes and simmer for 15 minutes. Toss with pasta. Garnish with parsley and serve with Parmesan.

Italian.title: Tiramisu
Italian.instructions: Beat egg yolks with sugar until thick. Add mascarpone and mix well. Whip cream and fold into mixture. Mix coffee with liqueur. Dip ladyfingers in coffee mixture. Layer in dish with cream mixture. Chill for 4 hours. Dust with cocoa powder before serving.

Spanish.title: Paella Valenciana
ingredients: 1 lb chicken thighs, cut into pieces
Spanish.instructions: Heat oil in large paella pan. Brown chicken and rabbit. Add vegetables and cook until soft. Add rice and cook for 2 minutes. Add stock, saffron, and seasonings. Simmer for 20 minutes without stirring. Let rest for 5 minutes. Serve with lemon wedges.

Spanish.title: Gazpacho Andaluz
Spanish.instructions: Chop all vegetables. Blend with oil, vinegar, and seasonings. Add water gradually until smooth. Chill for 2 hours. Serve cold with basil garnish.

Spanish.title: Tortilla Española
Spanish.instructions: Cook potatoes and onion in oil until tender. Beat eggs with salt. Add potato mixture to eggs. Cook in large skillet until set. Flip and cook other side. Serve warm or cold.

Spanish.title: Pulpo a la Gallega
Spanish.instructions: Boil octopus for 45 minutes until tender. Boil potatoes until done. Slice octopus and potatoes. Drizzle with oil and sprinkle with paprika and salt. Garnish with parsley and serve.

Spanish.title: Churros con Chocolate
Spanish.instructions: Boil water, butter, and salt. Add flour and stir until smooth. Beat in eggs one at a time. Pipe into hot oil and fry until golden. Roll in cinnamon sugar. For chocolate, heat cream and add chocolate and sugar. Stir until smooth. Serve churros with chocolate sauce.

Spanish.title: Quick Greek Salad
Spanish.instructions: Combine tomatoes, cucumber, onion, and olives in bowl. Top with feta cheese. Whisk olive oil, vinegar, oregano, salt, and pepper. Drizzle over salad. Toss gently and serve immediately.

Spanish.title: Quick Hummus
Spanish.instructions: Blend chickpeas, tahini, lemon juice, garlic, olive oil, cumin, and salt until smooth. Add water if needed for consistency. Serve with pita bread and vegetables.

Spanish.title: Quick Caprese Salad
Spanish.instructions: Arrange tomato and mozzarella slices on plate. Tuck basil leaves between slices. Drizzle with olive oil and balsamic vinegar. Season with salt and pepper. Serve immediately.

Spanish.title: Quick Pasta Aglio e Olio
Spanish.instructions: Cook pasta according to package directions. Heat olive oil and cook garlic until golden. Add red pepper flakes. Toss pasta with oil mixture. Add parsley and Parmesan. Season with salt. Serve immediately.

Spanish.title: Quick Bruschetta
Spanish.instructions: Toast bread slices. Mix tomatoes, garlic, basil, olive oil, and balsamic vinegar. Season with salt and pepper. Top bread with tomato mixture. Serve immediately.

Spanish.title: Quick Gazpacho
Spanish.instructions: Blend all vegetables until smooth. Add olive oil and vinegar. Season with salt and pepper. Chill for 10 minutes. Serve cold with fresh herbs.

Spanish.title: Quick Mediterranean Wrap
Spanish.instructions: Spread hummus on tortillas. Layer with greens, cucumber, tomatoes, feta, and olives. Drizzle with olive oil. Roll tightly and slice in half. Serve immediately.

Spanish.title: Quick Ratatouille
Spanish.instructions: Heat olive oil and cook onion until soft. Add garlic and cook for 1 minute. Add eggplant, zucchini, and bell pepper. Cook for 5 minutes. Add tomatoes and herbs. Simmer for 5 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.

Spanish.title: Quick Tabbouleh
Spanish.instructions: Soak bulgur in boiling water for 10 minutes. Drain and cool. Mix with tomatoes, cucumber, parsley, and mint. Whisk olive oil, lemon juice, and salt. Toss with salad. Chill for 10 minutes before serving.

Spanish.title: Quick Spanakopita
Spanish.instructions: Squeeze spinach dry. Mix with feta, eggs, herbs, salt, and pepper. Brush phyllo with olive oil. Layer 4 sheets, add filling, top with 4 more sheets. Bake at 375°F for 20 minutes until golden.

Spanish.title: Quick Greek Gyros
Spanish.instructions: Season lamb with oregano, salt, and pepper. Heat oil and cook lamb for 8 minutes. Warm pita breads. Fill with lamb, onion, tomatoes, cucumber, and tzatziki. Roll and serve hot.

Spanish.title: Quick Italian Pasta Primavera
Spanish.instructions: Cook pasta according to package. Heat oil and cook garlic for 1 minute. Add vegetables and cook for 5 minutes. Toss with pasta, Parmesan, and basil. Season with salt and pepper.

Spanish.title: Quick Spanish Tortilla
Spanish.instructions: Cook potatoes and onion in oil until tender. Beat eggs with salt and pepper. Add potato mixture to eggs. Cook in pan until set. Flip and cook other side. Serve warm.

Spanish.title: Quick Mediterranean Quinoa Bowl
Spanish.instructions: Cook quinoa in water for 15 minutes. Mix with cucumber, tomato, olives, and feta. Whisk olive oil, lemon juice, salt, and pepper. Toss with quinoa mixture. Serve at room temperature.

Spanish.title: Quick Greek Lemon Chicken
Spanish.instructions: Season chicken with oregano, salt, and pepper. Heat oil and cook chicken for 6 minutes per side. Add garlic and lemon juice. Cook for 2 more minutes. Serve hot.

Spanish.title: Quick Italian Bruschetta
Spanish.instructions: Toast bread slices. Mix tomatoes, garlic, basil, olive oil, and balsamic vinegar. Season with salt and pepper. Top bread with tomato mixture. Serve immediately.

Spanish.title: Quick Spanish Patatas Bravas
Spanish.instructions: Heat oil in pan. Add potatoes and cook for 12 minutes until golden and crispy. Season with paprika, cayenne, and salt. Serve with aioli sauce.

Spanish.title: Quick Mediterranean Fish
Spanish.instructions: Season fish with oregano, salt, and pepper. Heat oil and cook fish for 4 minutes per side. Add garlic, lemon juice, and olives. Cook for 2 more minutes. Serve hot.

Spanish.title: Quick Greek Tzatziki
Spanish.instructions: Squeeze cucumber dry. Mix with yogurt, garlic, olive oil, lemon juice, and dill. Season with salt. Chill for 10 minutes. Serve with pita bread.

Spanish.title: Quick Italian Risotto
Spanish.instructions: Sauté onion and garlic until soft. Add rice and cook for 2 minutes. Add broth gradually, stirring constantly. Cook for 18 minutes until creamy. Stir in Parmesan and butter. Season with salt and pepper.

Spanish.title: Quick Spanish Gazpacho
Spanish.instructions: Blend all vegetables until smooth. Add olive oil and vinegar. Season with salt and pepper. Chill for 10 minutes. Serve cold with croutons.

Spanish.title: Quick Mediterranean Pasta
Spanish.instructions: Cook pasta according to package. Heat oil and cook garlic for 1 minute. Add olives and sun-dried tomatoes. Toss with pasta, feta, and basil. Season with salt and pepper.

Spanish.title: Quick Greek Moussaka
Spanish.instructions: Cook eggplant slices for 5 minutes. Brown lamb with onion and garlic. Add tomatoes and cinnamon. Simmer for 10 minutes. Layer eggplant and lamb mixture. Top with Parmesan. Bake at 375°F for 20 minutes.

Spanish.title: Quick Italian Carbonara
Spanish.instructions: Cook pasta according to package. Cook bacon until crispy. Beat eggs with Parmesan and black pepper. Toss hot pasta with bacon and garlic. Remove from heat and add egg mixture. Toss quickly until creamy.

Spanish.title: Quick Spanish Paella
Spanish.instructions: Brown chicken in pan for 5 minutes. Add onion and garlic. Cook for 2 minutes. Add rice and cook for 2 minutes. Add broth, peas, bell peppers, and saffron. Simmer for 18 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.

ingredients: 1 lb chicken thighs, cut into pieces (450g)
Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
utensils_required: Large paella pan or wide shallow pan
cooking_instructions: Heat olive oil in paella pan over medium-high heat. Season chicken with salt and pepper. Brown chicken pieces for 5 minutes per side. Remove and set aside.
Add chorizo and cook for 3 minutes until browned. Add onion and garlic, cook for 5 minutes until softened.
Add tomatoes, bell pepper, and rice. Cook for 2 minutes, stirring constantly. Add wine and cook until absorbed.
Add stock, saffron, and paprika. Bring to boil, then reduce heat to medium. Add chicken back to pan.
Simmer for 15 minutes without stirring. Add seafood and peas. Cook for 5 more minutes until rice is tender and seafood is cooked. Garnish with parsley and serve with lemon wedges.
Spanish.chef_tips: The key to perfect paella is not stirring after adding the stock. The socarrat (crispy bottom layer) is the prize. Use the widest pan possible for even cooking and authentic presentation.

ingredients: Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
cooking_instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F. Cut eggplants in half lengthwise. Score flesh and brush with 1/4 cup olive oil. Bake for 30 minutes until tender.
Scoop out eggplant flesh, leaving shells intact. Chop flesh and set aside.
Heat remaining oil in large skillet. Add onion and garlic, cook for 5 minutes until softened. Add tomatoes and cook for 3 minutes.
Add eggplant flesh, pine nuts, raisins, herbs, and spices. Cook for 5 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.
Fill eggplant shells with mixture. Top with feta and breadcrumbs. Bake for 20 minutes until golden. Serve warm.
Spanish.chef_tips: The eggplant should be tender but not mushy. The combination of sweet raisins, savory pine nuts, and aromatic spices creates the perfect Mediterranean flavor profile.

ingredients: Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
cooking_instructions: Bring large pot of salted water to boil. Add bay leaves and onion. Add octopus and simmer for 45 minutes until tender.
Drain octopus and let cool. Cut into serving pieces.
Make marinade: whisk olive oil, vinegar, garlic, oregano, paprika, and lemon juice. Season with salt and pepper.
Marinate octopus for 30 minutes. Preheat grill to high heat.
Grill octopus for 3-4 minutes per side until charred and crispy. Serve with marinade and garnish with parsley and lemon wedges.
Spanish.chef_tips: The key is slow poaching followed by high-heat grilling. The octopus should be tender inside and crispy outside. Don't overcook during the poaching stage.

ingredients: 2 lbs lamb shoulder, cut into cubes (900g)
Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
cooking_instructions: Season lamb with salt and pepper. Heat olive oil in tagine over medium-high heat. Brown lamb in batches for 5 minutes per side. Remove and set aside.
Add onions and garlic to tagine. Cook for 8 minutes until softened. Add spices and cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
Return lamb to tagine. Add tomatoes, dried fruits, and stock. Bring to boil, then reduce heat to low.
Cover and simmer for 1.5 hours until lamb is tender. Add almonds and cook for 10 more minutes.
Garnish with cilantro and serve with couscous.
Spanish.chef_tips: The slow, gentle cooking in a tagine creates incredibly tender meat. The combination of sweet dried fruits and savory lamb is quintessentially Mediterranean.

ingredients: Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
cooking_instructions: If using fresh grape leaves, blanch in boiling water for 2 minutes. Drain and set aside.
Make filling: mix rice, onion, garlic, pine nuts, currants, herbs, olive oil, lemon juice, and spices. Season with salt and pepper.
Place grape leaves vein-side up. Add 1 tbsp filling to center of each leaf. Fold sides over filling and roll tightly.
Arrange dolmas in steamer insert. Add water to pot and steam for 45 minutes until rice is tender.
Let cool to room temperature. Serve with lemon wedges.
Spanish.chef_tips: The rolling technique takes practice - the dolmas should be tight but not overstuffed. The combination of herbs and spices creates the authentic Mediterranean flavor.

ingredients: Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
Fresh parsley and fennel fronds for garnish
cooking_instructions: Heat olive oil in large pot over medium heat. Add onions, garlic, and fennel. Cook for 8 minutes until softened.
Add tomatoes, orange peel, fennel seeds, bay leaves, and saffron. Cook for 5 minutes until tomatoes break down.
Add fish stock and wine. Bring to boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 20 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.
Add fish fillets and cook for 5 minutes. Add shellfish and cook for 3-4 minutes until shells open. Discard any unopened shells.
Ladle into bowls, garnish with parsley and fennel fronds. Serve with rouille sauce and crusty bread.
Spanish.chef_tips: The key is using the freshest seafood possible and building layers of flavor with the aromatic base. The saffron is essential for authentic bouillabaisse.

ingredients: 2 lbs fresh spinach, washed and chopped (900g)
Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
cooking_instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Heat 2 tbsp olive oil in large skillet over medium heat. Add onion and garlic, cook for 5 minutes until softened.
Add spinach in batches, cooking until wilted and excess moisture evaporates, about 8 minutes. Season with salt, pepper, and nutmeg.
Transfer spinach to large bowl. Let cool slightly, then add feta, ricotta, eggs, dill, and parsley. Mix well.
Brush baking dish with melted butter. Layer 8 phyllo sheets, brushing each with butter. Add spinach filling.
Top with remaining phyllo sheets, brushing each with butter. Score top into squares. Bake for 35-40 minutes until golden brown.
Spanish.chef_tips: Ensure spinach is completely dry before mixing with cheese to prevent soggy phyllo. The key is layering phyllo properly and brushing each sheet with butter for crispiness.

ingredients: 1.5 lbs pork shoulder, cut into 1-inch cubes (680g)
Sliced tomatoes and red onions for serving
cooking_instructions: Combine pork with olive oil, lemon juice, garlic, oregano, thyme, salt, and pepper. Marinate for 30 minutes at room temperature.
For tzatziki: Grate cucumber, salt lightly, and let drain in towel for 10 minutes. Mix with yogurt, garlic, olive oil, lemon juice, and dill.
Thread pork onto skewers. Grill over medium-high heat for 12-15 minutes, turning occasionally, until cooked through.
Warm pita breads on grill for 1 minute per side. Serve souvlaki with tzatziki, tomatoes, and onions.
Spanish.chef_tips: Don't overcook the pork - it should be juicy and slightly pink inside. The tzatziki needs time for flavors to meld, so make it ahead if possible.

ingredients: 1 whole chicken, cut into pieces (3-4 lbs) (1.4-1.8kg)
Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
cooking_instructions: Place chicken in large pot with stock. Bring to boil, reduce heat, and simmer for 20 minutes until chicken is cooked through.
Remove chicken and strain stock. Return stock to pot, add rice, and simmer for 15 minutes until rice is tender.
Whisk egg whites until frothy. Gradually whisk in egg yolks, then lemon juice. Temper with hot stock, whisking constantly.
Slowly whisk egg mixture into soup. Add dill, season with salt and pepper. Serve immediately with lemon wedges.
Spanish.chef_tips: The key is tempering the eggs slowly to prevent curdling. The soup should be silky smooth with a perfect balance of lemon and chicken flavors.

ingredients: Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
cooking_instructions: Cook pasta according to package directions until al dente. Drain and set aside. Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Brown ground meats with onion and garlic in large skillet over medium heat for 8 minutes. Add tomatoes, paste, wine, and spices. Simmer for 20 minutes.
Make béchamel: Melt butter, whisk in flour, cook for 2 minutes. Gradually whisk in milk, cook until thickened. Remove from heat, whisk in eggs and half the cheese.
Layer half the pasta in baking dish. Top with meat sauce, then remaining pasta. Pour béchamel over top, sprinkle with remaining cheese.
Bake for 45-50 minutes until golden brown and bubbly. Let rest for 15 minutes before serving.
Spanish.chef_tips: This is Greece's answer to lasagna. The key is the perfect béchamel sauce and letting it rest before cutting to maintain layers.

cooking_instructions: Rinse grape leaves and blanch in boiling water for 2 minutes. Drain and set aside. Rinse rice until water runs clear.
Heat olive oil in skillet over medium heat. Add onion and cook for 5 minutes until softened. Add rice, dill, mint, parsley, lemon juice, salt, and pepper. Cook for 3 minutes.
Place grape leaf vein-side up. Add 1 tbsp rice mixture near stem end. Fold sides over, then roll tightly from stem to tip.
Arrange dolmades seam-side down in pot. Add stock and remaining olive oil. Cover with plate to weigh down. Simmer for 40 minutes until rice is tender.
Let cool in pot. Serve at room temperature with lemon wedges.
Spanish.chef_tips: The key is not overstuffing the leaves and rolling them tightly. The plate on top prevents them from unraveling during cooking.

cooking_instructions: Dissolve yeast and sugar in warm water. Let stand for 5 minutes until foamy. Mix flour and salt in large bowl.
Add yeast mixture to flour. Mix until smooth dough forms. Cover and let rise for 1 hour until doubled.
Heat oil to 375°F (190°C) in deep fryer. Drop small spoonfuls of dough into hot oil. Fry for 3-4 minutes until golden brown.
Drain on paper towels. Warm honey in small saucepan. Drizzle over puffs, sprinkle with walnuts and cinnamon, dust with powdered sugar.
Spanish.chef_tips: These are Greece's answer to donuts. The key is maintaining consistent oil temperature and not overcrowding the fryer.
